member.remarks: A value of true indicates that a state change always requires a restart. Version strings are a number followed by a sequence of numbers or dots. Pre-release versions may append a space and a single-word suffix like "beta2". Examples:
"1.2" "11.0.34" "2.0 beta" "1.3 beta2" "1.0 b2" "12.4 alpha" "11.0.34.234.254"

member.value: Username of the splunk.com account for publishing an application to Splunkbase.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ApplicationAttributes.Configured
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether custom setup has been performed on an application.
member.value: true, if custom setup has been performed on the application; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ApplicationAttributes.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the short explanatory string displayed underneath the title of an application in Launcher.
member.remarks: Short descriptions of about 200 characters are most effective.
member.value: A short explanatory string that is displayed underneath the title of the application in Launcher.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ApplicationAttributes.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of an application for display in the Splunk GUI and Launcher.
member.value: The name of the application for display in the Splunk GUI and Launcher.
member.remarks:
Splunk recommends lengths between five and eighty characters. Values must not include "Splunk For" as a prefix. Examples of good labels:
"IMAP Monitor" "FISMA Compliance" "SQL Server Integration Services"

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ApplicationAttributes.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version string for an application.
member.remarks:
Version strings are a number followed by a sequence of numbers or dots. Pre-release versions can append a space and a single-word suffix like "beta2". Each release of an application must change the version number. Examples:
"1.2" "11.0.34" "2.0 beta" "1.3 beta2" "1.0 b2" "12.4 alpha" "11.0.34.234.254"
member.value: An application version string.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ApplicationAttributes.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if an is visible and navigable from Splunk Web.
member.remarks: Visible apps require at least one view that is available from Splunk Web.
member.value: true, if the application is visible and navigable from Splunk Web; otherwise false.

member.name: T:Splunk.Client.Configuration
member.summary: Provides a class for accessing and updating Splunk configuration files.
member.remarks:
Splunk's configuration information is stored in configuration files. These files are identified by their .conf extension and hold the information for different aspects of your Splunk configurations, including:
System settings
Authentication and authorization information
Index mappings and setting
Deployment and cluster configurations
Knowledge objects and saved searches
Most configuration files come packaged with your Splunk installation and can be found in $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/default.
References:
Admin Manual: About configuration files.
Admin Manual: List of configuration files.
REST API Reference: Accessing and updating Splunk configurations.
REST API Reference: Configurations.

member.name: M:Splunk.Client.Context.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all disposable resources used by the current .
member.remarks: Do not override this method. Override instead.

member.name: M:Splunk.Client.Context.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .
member.remarks:
Subclasses should implement the disposable pattern as follows:
Override this method and call it from the override.
Provide a finalizer, if needed, and call this method from it.
To help ensure that resources are always cleaned up appropriately, ensure that the override is callable multiple times without throwing an exception.
There is no performance benefit in overriding this method on types that use only managed resources (such as arrays) because they are automatically reclaimed by the garbage collector. See Implementing a Dispose Method.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Provides arguments for setting the attributes of an .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.BlockSignSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of events that make up a block for block signatures on an .
member.remarks: The default value is zero (0) indicating that block signatures are disabled. If your index requires block signatures, a value is 100 is recommended.
member.value: The number of events that make up a block for block signatures on an .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.BucketRebuildMemoryHint
member.summary: Gets or sets a suggested size for the time-series (tsidx) file created by the Splunk bucket rebuild process.
member.remarks:
The default value is "auto" suggests that the size for the tsidx file created by the Splunk bucker rebuild process should vary based on the amount of physical RAM. Values other than "auto" must be 16MB-1GB. You can specify a value using a size prefix: "16777216" and "16MB" are equivalent.
Caution: Do not set this value unless instructed by Splunk Support. It is an advanced parameter. If set incorrectly Splunk will not start when a rebuild is required.
member.value: A suggested size for the time-series (tsidx) file created by the Splunk bucket rebuild process.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.ColdToFrozenDir
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to a directory for the frozen archive of an .
member.remarks: This property is an alternative to . If and are specified, takes precedence. Splunk will automatically put frozen buckets in this directory.
member.value: The path to a directory for the frozen archive of an

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.ColdToFrozenScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an archiving script for the frozen archive of an .
member.remarks: If your script requires a program to run it (for example, python), specify the program followed by the path. The script must be in $SPLUNK_HOME/bin or one of its subdirectories.
member.value: The path to an archiving script for the frozen archive of an .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.CompressRawData
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to an archiving script for the frozen archive of an .
member.remarks: If your script requires a program to run it (for example, python), specify the program followed by the path. The script must be in $SPLUNK_HOME/bin or one of its subdirectories.
member.value: The path to an archiving script for the frozen archive of an .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.EnableOnlineBucketRepair
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether asynchronous bucket repair should be enabled on an .
member.remarks: The default value is true indicating that asynchronous bucker repair should be enabled. You do not have to wait until buckets are repaired to start Splunk. You may observe a slight performance degradation while bucket repair is underway.
member.value: true, if asynchronous bucket repair should be enabled on an ; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.FrozenTimePeriodInSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of seconds after which indexed data rolls to frozen.
member.remarks: The default value is 188697600, equivalent to six years.
member.value: A value that specifies the number of seconds after which indexed data rolls to frozen.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxBloomBackfillBucketAge
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies when to stop rebuilding bloom filters for the warm or cold buckets of an .
member.remarks: Express this value as a string of the form <![CDATA[<integer> ("d"|"h"|"m"|"s"]]>. The default is "30d" which tells Splunk to stop rebuilding bloom filters on warm or cold buckets when they are 30 days old.
member.value: A string that specifies when to stop rebuilding bloom filters for the warm or cold buckets of an .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxConcurrentOptimizes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of concurrent optimize processes that can run against a hot bucket.
member.remarks: The default value is 6.
member.value: A value that specifies the number of concurrent optimize processes that can run against a hot bucket.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxDataSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies the maximum size in megabytes for a hot database to reach before a roll to warm is triggered.
member.remarks: Express this value as a string of the form <![CDATA[<integer> |"auto"|"auto_high_volume"]]> Specifying "auto" or "auto_high_volume" causes Splunk to autotune the size at which a roll to warm is triggered. Use "auto_high_volume" for high volume indexes (such as the main index); otherwise, use "auto". The defaultis "auto". < para> A "high volume index" would typically be considered one that gets over 10GB of data per day. Although the maximum value you can set is 1048576, equivalent to 1 TB, a reasonable number ranges from 100 to 50000. Any number outside this range should be approved by Splunk Support before proceeding. If you specify an invalid number or string, this value will be auto tuned. <note type="note"> The precise size of your warm buckets may vary from due to post-processing and timing issues with the rolling policy.
member.value: A string that specifies the maximum size in megabytes for a hot database to reach before a roll to warm is triggered.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxHotBuckets
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of hot buckets that an can have.
member.remarks:
When this value is is exceeded, Splunk rolls the least recently used hot bucket to warm. Both normal hot buckets and quarantined hot buckets count towards this total. The default is 3.
This setting operates independently of which can also cause hot buckets to roll.
member.value: A value that specifies the maximum number of hot buckets that an can have.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxHotIdleSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the life time of an idle hot bucket in seconds.
member.remarks: If the lifetime of an idle hot bucket exceeds this value, Splunk rolls it to warm. The default is 0 which specifies that the lifetime.
member.value: A value that specifies the life time of an idle hot bucket in seconds.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxHotSpanSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the upper bound of target maximum timespan of hot/warm buckets in seconds.
member.remarks: The default value is 7776000, equivalent to 90 days. Splunk enforces a lower bound of 3600, equivalent to one hour. <note type="caution"> This is an advanced property that should be set with care and understanding of the characteristics of your data. If it is too small, you can get an explosion of hot/warm buckets in the file system.
member.value: A value that specifies the upper bound of target maximum timespan of hot/warm buckets in seconds.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxMemMB
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of megabytes of memroy to allocate for buffering a single index file before flushing it to disk.
member.remarks:
The default value is 5. This is the recommended value for all environments.
Calculate this value carefully. Setting it incorrectly may have adverse effects on your system's memory and/or splunkd stability and performance.
member.value: A value that specifies the number of megabytes of memroy to allocate for buffering a single index file before flushing it to disk.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxMetaEntries
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of unique lines in the .data files in a bucket.
member.remarks:
Setting this value may help reduce memory consumption. The default value is 1000000. If this limit is exceeded, a hot bucket is rolled to prevent further increase. If your buckets are rolling due to Strings.data hitting this limit, the culprit may be the punct field. If you don't use punct, it may be best to simply disable Strings.data. See props.conf.spec.
There is a small time delay between detecting and acting on this limit. Consequently a bucket may grow beyond this limit before it is rolled.
member.value: A value that specifies the maximum number of unique lines in the data files in a bucket.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxTimeUnreplicatedNoAcks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the upper limit in seconds on how long an event can sit in raw slice.
member.remarks: This value only applies if replication is enabled. It is otherwise ignored. The default value is 60, equivalent to one minute.
member.value: An upper limit in seconds on how long an event can sit in raw slice.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxTimeUnreplicatedWithAcks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the upper limit in seconds on how long events can sit unacknowledged in a raw slice.
member.remarks: This value only applies if you have enabled acks on forwarders and have replication enabled with clustering. It is otherwise ignored. The default value is 300, equivalent to five minutes.
member.value: An upper limit in seconds on how long events can sit unacknowledged in a raw slice.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxTotalDataSizeMB
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum size of an in megabytes.
member.remarks: The default value is 500000. If an grows larger than the specified number of megabytes, the oldest data is frozen.
member.value: The maximum size of an in megabytes.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MaxWarmDBCount
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of warm buckets.
member.remarks: The default value is 300. If the number of buckets grows larger than this, the warm buckets with the lowest value for their latest times will be moved to cold.
member.value: The maximum number of warm buckets.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MinRawFileSyncSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that specifies how frequently splunkd forces a file system sync while compressing journal slices.
member.remarks: Express this value as a string of the form <![CDATA[(<integer> |"disable")]]>. If you specify a value of "0", splunkd forces a file system sync after every slice completes compressing. If you specify a value of "disable", splunkd disables syncing entirely: Uncompressed slices are removed as soon as compression is complete. The default is "disable".
member.value: A string that specifies how frequently splunkd forces a file system sync while compressing journal slices.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.MinStreamGroupQueueSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum size of the queue that stores events in memory before committing them to a .tsidx file.
member.remarks:
The default value is 2000.
Do not set this value, except under advice from Splunk support.
member.value: The minimum size of the queue that stores events in memory before committing them to a .tsidx file.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.PartialServiceMetaPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies in seconds how often metadata sync occurs for records where the sync can be done efficiently in-place, without requiring a full re-write of the metadata file.
member.remarks: The default value is 0. Zero means that this feature is disabled and is the only time when metadata sync occurs.
member.value: A value that specifies in seconds how often metadata sync occurs for records where the sync can be done efficiently in-place, without requiring a full re-write of the metadata file.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.ProcessTrackerServiceInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies in seconds how often the indexer checks the status of the child operating system processes it has launched to see if it can launch new processes for queued requests.
member.remarks: The default value is 15. Zero means the indexer will check child process status every second. This value is capped at 4294967295, equivalent to .
member.value: A value that specifies in seconds how often the indexer checks the status of the child operating system processes it has launched to see if it can launch new processes for queued requests.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.QuarantineFutureSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies in seconds when new events are dropped into a quarantine bucket.
member.remarks: Events with a timestamp newer than now plus this value are dropped into a quarantine bucket. This is a mechanism to prevent main hot buckets from being polluted with fringe events. The default value is 2592000, equivalent to thirty days.
member.value: A value that specifies in seconds when new events are dropped into a quarantine bucket.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.QuarantinePastSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies in seconds when old events are dropped into a quarantine bucket.
member.remarks: Events with a timestamp older than now plus this value are dropped into a quarantine bucket. This is a mechanism to prevent main hot buckets from being polluted with fringe events. The default value is 77760000, equivalent to 900 days.
member.value: A value that specifies in seconds when old events are dropped into a quarantine bucket.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.RawChunkSizeBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a target uncompressed size in bytes for individual raw slice in the raw data journal of an .
member.remarks:
The default value is 131072, equivalent to 128 KB. Zero is not a valid value. If zero is specified, rawChunkSizeBytes is set to the default value.
This value only specifies a target chunk size. The actual chunk size may be slightly larger by an amount proportional to an individual event size.
This is an advanced property. Only change it if you are instructed to do so by Splunk Support.
member.value: A value that specifies a target uncompressed size in bytes for individual raw slice in the raw data journal of an .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.RepFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls index replication.
member.remarks: This property only applies to Splunk Enterprise clustering slaves. Specify a value of "auto to use the master index replication configuration value. Specify a value of "0" to turn replication off. The default is "0".
member.value: A value that controls index replication.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.RotatePeriodInSecs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies in seconds how frequently to check if a new hot bucket needs to be created as well as if there are any warm/cold buckets that should be rolled/frozen.
member.remarks: The default value is 60, equivalent to one minute.
member.value: A value that specifies in seconds how frequently to check if a new hot bucket needs to be created as well as if there are any warm/cold buckets that should be rolled/frozen.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.ServiceMetaPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies in seconds how frequently metadata is synced to disk.
member.remarks: The default value is 25. You may want to set this to a higher value if the sum of your metadata file sizes is larger than many tens of megabytes to avoid the hit on I/O in the indexing fast path.
member.value: A value that specifies in seconds how frequently metadata is synced to disk.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.SyncMeta
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a sync operation is called before a file descriptor is closed on metadata file updates.
member.remarks:
The default value is true. This improves integrity of metadata files, especially in regards to operating system crashes and machine failures.
Do not change this parameter without the input of a Splunk Support.
member.value: true, if a sync operation is called before a file descriptor is closed on metadata file updates; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.ThrottleCheckPeriod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies in seconds how frequently to check for an throttling condition.
member.remarks:
The default value is 15.
Do not change this parameter without the input of a Splunk Support.
member.value: A value that specifies in seconds how frequently to check for an throttling condition.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.TStatsHomePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the location to store datamodel acceleration .tsidx data for an .
member.remarks: Restart splunkd after changing this value. It must be defined in terms of a volume definition and the location must be writable. The default is volume:_splunk_summaries/$_index_name/tstats.
member.value: The location to store datamodel acceleration .tsidx data for an .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IndexAttributes.WarmToColdScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of a script to run when moving data from warm to cold.
member.remarks:
This property is supported for backwards compatibility with Splunk versions older than 4.0. Contact Splunk support if you need help.
Migrating data across file systems is now handled natively by splunkd. If you specify a script here, the script becomes responsible for moving the event data, and Splunk-native data migration will not be used.
member.value: The location of a script to run when moving data from warm to cold.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.IServerSettings.MinFreeSpace
member.summary: Gets the amount of space in megabytes that must exist for splunkd to continue operating.
member.remarks: This value affects search and indexing. Before attempting to launch a search, Splunk requires this amount of free space on the file system where the dispatch directory is located: "$SPLUNK_HOME/var/run/splunk/dispatch). It is applied similarly to the search quota values in authorize.conf and limits.conf. Splunk periodically checks space on all partitions that contain indexes as specified by indexes.conf. When you need to clear more disk space indexing is paused and Splunk posts a UI banner and warning.
member.value: The minimum free space.

member.remarks: A value of 0 specifies that a is never automatically finalized.
member.value: A value that specifies how many events a must process before it is automatically finalized.

member.summary: Gets or sets a time string that specifies the earliest inclusive time bounds for a .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.Now
member.summary: Gets or sets a time string to set the absolute time used for any relative time specifier in a search .
member.remarks: The default value is the current system time. You can specify a relative time modifier for this property. For example, set the value to "+2d" to specify the current time plus two days. If you specify a relative time modifier both in this parameter and in the search string, the search string modifier takes precedence. See Time modifiers for search for details on relative time modifiers.
member.value: A time string to set the absolute time used for any relative time specifier in a search .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.RealTimeMaxBlockSeconds

member.remarks: This property only applies to realtime search jobs. The default value is 60, equivalent to one minute. Specify a value of 0 to block for an indefinite period of time.
member.value: The maximum time to block when is true.

member.remarks: This property only applies to realtime search jobs. The default value is 10000 events.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.RequiredFieldList
member.summary: Gets or sets a required field list to a search .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.ReuseMaxSecondsAgo
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the number of seconds ago to check when an identical search was started and returns that search ID instead of starting a new .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.SearchListener
member.summary: Gets or sets a value used to register a search state listener with a search .
member.value: Search state listener registration entry.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.SearchMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode for a search .
member.remarks:
The default value is .Normal. If set to .RealTimerealtime, the search runs over live data. A real-time search may also be indicated by setting the and properties to "rt" even if the SearchMode is set to .Normal.
For a real-time search, if both and are set to "rt", the search represents all appropriate live data received since the start of the search. Additionally, if and/or are set to "rt" followed by a relative time specifier then a sliding window is used where the time bounds of the window are determined by the relative time specifiers and are continuously updated based on the wall-clock time.
member.value: The mode for a search .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.SpawnProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a search should run in a separate spawned process.
member.remarks: The default value is true. Searches against indexes must run in a separate process.
member.value: true, if the search should run in a separate spawned process; false otherwise.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.StatusBuckets
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum number of status buckets to generate for a search .
member.remarks: The default value is 0.
member.value: The maximum number of status buckets to generate for the search .

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.JobArgs.SyncBundleReplication
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a should wait for bundle synchronization with all search peers.
member.remarks: The default value is false.
member.value: true, if the should wait for bundle synchronization with all search peers; false otherwise.

member.remarks: The default value is the ISO-8601 format.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.SavedSearchAttributes.AutoSummarizeCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets a search command template that constructs the auto summarization for a .
member.remarks:
This is an advanced feature. Do not set this value unless you understand the architecture of auto summarization of saved searches. The default value is:
summarize override=partial timespan=$auto_summarize.timespan$ max_summary_size=$auto_summarize.max_summary_size$ max_summary_ratio=$auto_summarize.max_summary_ratio$ max_disabled_buckets=$auto_summarize.max_disabled_buckets$ max_time=$auto_summarize.max_time$ [ $search$ ]

Running all of them every 20 minutes (*/20) means they would all launch at hh:00, hh:20, and hh:40 and this might slow your system every twenty minutes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the time to live (in seconds) for the artifacts of a , if no actions are triggered.

remarks.para: The default value is "2p" (two scheduled search periods).

If an action is triggered, Splunk changes the time to live (TTL) to that action's TTL. If multiple actions are triggered, Splunk applies the maximum TTL to the artifacts. To set an action's TTL, refer to alert_actions.conf.spec in the Splunk Admin Manual.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.SavedSearchAttributes.MaxConcurrent
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of concurrent instances of a the scheduler is allowed to run.
member.remarks: The default value is 1.
member.value: The maximum number of concurrent instances of a the scheduler is allowed to run.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.SavedSearchAttributes.RealTimeSchedule
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a is to be run on a realtime schedule.
member.remarks:
The default value is true. The scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled run time or the current time. If this value is false, the scheduler bases its determination of the next scheduled on the last run time. This is called continuous scheduling.
The scheduler never skips scheduled execution periods when a is configured for continuous scheduling. However, the execution of the might fall behind depending on the scheduler's load. Use continuous scheduling whenever you enable the summary index option.
When a is configured for realtime scheduling, the scheduler might skip some execution periods to make sure that the scheduler is executing the searches running over the most recent time range. The scheduler tries to execute searches configured for realtime scheduling before it executes searches that have continuous scheduling.
member.value: true, if a is to be run on a realtime schedule; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.SavedSearchAttributes.RestartOnSearchPeerAdd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to restart a realtime managed by the scheduler when a new search peer becomes available.
member.remarks: The default value is true.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.SavedSearchAttributes.RunOnStartup
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a runs when Splunk starts.
member.remarks: The default value is false indicating that after Splunk starts, the runs at its next scheduled time.
member.value: true, if a runs when Splunk starts; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.SearchExportArgs.SearchMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode for a search .
member.remarks:
The default value is .Normal. If set to .RealTimerealtime, the search runs over live data. A real-time search may also be indicated by setting the and properties to "rt" even if the SearchMode is set to .Normal.
For a real-time search, if both and are set to "rt", the search represents all appropriate live data received since the start of the search. Additionally, if and/or are set to "rt" followed by a relative time specifier then a sliding window is used where the time bounds of the window are determined by the relative time specifiers and are continuously updated based on the wall-clock time.

member.summary: Provides arguments for updating Splunk setting values.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.SplunkDB
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to the default index for this instance of Splunk.
member.remarks: The default location is "$SPLUNK_HOME/var/lib/splunk/defaultdb/db/".
member.value: The splunk database.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.EnableSplunkWebSsl
member.summary: Gets or sets a toggles between HTTPS and HTTP.
member.remarks: A value of true enables https and SSL for Splunk Web. A value of false enables http and disables SSL for Splunk Web.
member.value: The enable splunk web ssl.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.Host
member.summary: Gets or sets the default hostname for data inputs that do not provide one.
member.value: The default hostname to use for data inputs that do not provide one.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.HttpPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the Specifies the port on which Splunk Web is listening for this instance of Splunk.
member.remarks: The default value is 8000. Use the HTTPS port number if is true.
member.value: The HTTP port.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.ManagementHostPort
member.summary: Gets or sets the port on which Splunk is listening for management operations.
member.remarks: The default value is 8089.
member.value: The management host port.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.MinFreeSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a safe amount of space in megabytes that must exist for splunkd to continue operating.
member.remarks: This value affects search and indexing. Before attempting to launch a search, Splunk requires this amount of free space on the file system where the dispatch directory is located: "$SPLUNK_HOME/var/run/splunk/dispatch). It is applied similarly to the search quota values in authorize.conf and limits.conf. Splunk periodically checks space on all partitions that contain indexes as specified by indexes.conf. When you need to clear more disk space indexing is paused and Splunk posts a UI banner and warning.
member.value: The minimum free space.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.Pass4SymmetricKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the password string that is prefixed to the Splunk symmetric key, generating the final key to sign all traffic between master/slave licensers.
member.value: The pass 4 symmetric key.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.ServerName
member.summary: Gets or sets an ASCII String to use as the name of a Splunk instance for features such as distributed search.
member.remarks: The default value is <![CDATA[<hostname>-<user-running- splunk>]]>.
member.value: The name of the server.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.SessionTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a time range string to set the amount of time before a user session times out.
member.remarks: Express this value as a search-like time range. The default is "1h" (one hour).
member.value: The session timeout.
member.remarks:
Examples:
args.SessionTimeout = "24h"; // 24 hours args.SessionTimeout = "3d"; // 3 days args.SessionTimeout = 7200s; // 7,200 seconds or two hours ///

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.StartWebServer
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that enables or disables Splunk Web.
member.remarks: Specify a value of true to enable Splunk Web.
member.value: The start web server.

member.name: P:Splunk.Client.ServerSettingValues.TrustedIP
member.summary: Gets or sets the IP address of the authenticating proxy.
member.remarks: The authenticating proxy is disabled by default. Set to a valid IP address to enable single signo on (SSO). A normal value is "127.0.0.1".
member.value: The trusted IP.

member.name: M:Splunk.Client.Service.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
member.remarks:
Subclasses should implement the disposable pattern as follows:
Override this method and call it from the override.
Provide a finalizer, if needed, and call this method from it.
To help ensure that resources are always cleaned up appropriately, ensure that the override is callable multiple times without throwing an exception.
There is no performance benefit in overriding this method on types that use only managed resources (such as arrays) because they are automatically reclaimed by the garbage collector. See Implementing a Dispose Method.
